review: This review is based on the promotional pre-order price that was available to prime members.We use the Firestick on our bedroom TV and Chromecast out in the living room. The Firestick is nice in that the interface is comprehensive of all content. We have not used the prime app as a remote- only the hardware remote. It gets confusing if we lose that tiny little remote. Changing between apps/content is much smoother than the Chromecast and of course the Firestick includes amazon prime, which Chromecast does not.Chromecast is individual apps casting content so changing between apps (Hulu to Netflix) can be a less than smooth. However, I really like mirroring my web browser for things like reading, twitter, etc.. Also, it is much more portable since it is just the drive and your phone, which is always on your person. Chromecast is better for portability and casting the Chrome browser. Firestick is better in having most content.
